In the end, the 10th person is left with just a little bit of meat on the fin of a fish.The Longevity noodles, however, was the best I've had. The texture was springy enough and very tasty. It is not too salty. Moist enough, yet not oily. As the dinner was a birthday celebration, I have no complaint on the cost.
Chinese fine dinning, great food, great ambience and great service. This is one of the best place to get great authentic traditional Cantonese food.

Since moving to Singapore, I've been on a quest for the best dim sum in town. I found me 3 girlfriends who share the same passion for steamed dumplings and we've been on a mission since.Our ratings are based on:1) Overall Yumminess (one shouldn't be trekking to a dim sum spot for any one particular dish)2) Ambiance3) ServiceHaving previously lived in HK, Lei Garden has been on the radar so we finally booked last Saturday:Definitely amongst the better har gows and siu mais in town. Far from the best, but sitting comfortably above the mediocre line. Everything arrived promptly, which is always key for two reasons: dim sum ought to be served pipping hot, and more importantly to maximize variety at any given moment.The space was nice enough, a bit tired, but comfortable and pleasant with a nice weekend crowd. The kind of place you could invite fellow yummy mummies or future in-laws to.Service - everyone was friendly and adequate though they didn't give me much else to say about that. Verdict: I've added Lei Gardens to our Return list, which isn't bad considering there are only about 3-4 other places on the list.
Been here a couple of times and i got to say I love the ambience of this place. And along with some good food its a good experience. Service is great as well and I have no complains about this place.

Very expensive and the waiters hassle you to order more food than you will actually eat. I don't get a lot of things about this place, like why people eat little tortillas with only a piece of duck skin inside. If I hadn't been there on business, I wouldn't have gone. The wasabi shrimp were good though.

Michelin star dim sum? Sign me up! The dim sum overall was delicious. The flavors are much more delicate than standard dim sum so you really need to be present to fully enjoy. I highly recommend the crispy pork belly cubes. The service was good...maybe too good? We weren't "allowed" to pour our own tea. In one attempt, two staffers ran towards us and grabbed the tea kettle from our hands to pour our tea. I also had an "encounter" with a waitress that wouldn't allow me to rest my phone and wallet on the floor, just under my chair (I do this because I'm easily distracted by the constant stream of push messages on my phone. My goal is to put the phone away and to be fully engaged with my friends.) So, how did the waitress resolve this? She brought another chair over and set it besides our table for my phone and wallet to be placed...properly. :) I was tickled by this experience. Overall, highly recommended.

This ranks amongst the top dim sum / cantonese cuisine restaurant in Singapore, IMO. Food quality and service is top notch; but what make them stand out amongst the top is the price. Value for money!!!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Came here for an impromptu lunch. Hardly visit Raffles City Shopping Centre when I was home but was so surprised how it has changed for the past decade or so. Not sure where to grab lunch so I decided to drop by Prego. Prego is located at the Fairmont hotel side. Staff would take my temperature after I scanned a QR code to check in for contact tracing.FOOD 5/5The spaghetti carbonara was really really good! Possibly the best I had in the past decades or ever. The bread that came before the meal was to die for. they looked like they made them in-house. I ended the lunch with an order of tiramisu. I already know how good that tiramisu was since I had room service while I was serving my stay home notice at Swissotel Stamford.SERVICE 5/5Staffs were wonderful and checked on me throughout the lunch. They were friendly too.AMBIENCE 5/5I suspect the last time I been to Prego was over a decade ago. They have probably renovated the restaurant many times since. The restaurant is beautiful and I love the decor especially that Fiat in the middle of the restaurant.Solid food, wonderful service with a beautiful ambience = Prego I would definitely return and check out more items the next time I am in Singapore!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Still an old time fave. This place holds memories of dates when I was at universities and family dinners. As well as time spent when I started my own family. Food and service is great. Of course you cannot beat the central location too!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Nice Italian place in the Fairmont. We really like the tiramisu here as it's right balance of boozy and coffee flavors. The other dishes are also decent and it's a huge place so you'll always get seating.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: We were in the area and decided to drop by for lunch as I remembered that I could enjoy 50% discount with AMEX credit card when dining for 2 persons. The staff took down my name before showing us to a table.After placing our orders, we were served bread with cream cheese in a wooden box and iced water. One could also enjoy the bread with vinegar or olive oil which was available in a bottle on the table.Prego Pizza ($38++)Mozzarella, Ham, Mushroom, Parmesan, Sundried Tomato, Fresh CreamThe pizza crust was thin and crispy, and cut easily. Although it looked thin, the filling was just nice.Agnolotti di Vitello al Sugo d' Arrosto ($36++)Confit Veal Ravioli, Veal Glace, Whipped Truffle CreamThe dish smelt quite nice of truffle. The ravioli was a tab hard. The filling was meaty and went quite well with the sauce.The place was packed during lunch. We did not wait long for the food to be served, although I wish that the water was refilled more often.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: If you are staying at the Fairmont, in the morning they have the breakfast buffet here for guest. They have quite an impressive spread of options in the morning, definitely something for everyone and was vegetarian friendly. Also had dinner here after a day full of exploring, I managed to crawl my tired legs here for food. The service was excellent and friendly, and the food was quite good. Whether its breakfast or a good pasta dinner you are in need of, this place has you covered.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: A great meal as always. I had the cod with baby potatoes. Hubby had grilled sea bass. For dessert I had a sinful caramel mousse with vanilla ice cream and an affogato mousse hidden under the ice cream. Hubby had a boring but good tiramisu  And check out the beautiful mosaic floor of the restaurant #maneklady #manekeats

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: The thing about Prego or any of the restaurants in Fairmont or Swissotel the Stamford is that the chef is only there for 2 years? Apparently they rotate the head chefs among their hotels worldwide to refresh the menu. But the staple or favorite dishes will remain. I was back there last night and discovered the new chef came in 3 months ago and the menu has been tweaked slightly. So certain items which my friend raved about were no longer there. So do go back often if you like a particular dish as it may not be around a few years later. My favorite dishes are a white pizza and cannolo dessert from a few years ago. I am hoping they will bring that back again. The white pizza was simply brushed with olive oil and herbs and topped with parma ham, mushrooms and cheese. So simple and so good. The cannolo was filled with sweet cream and served with a scoop of ice cream and fruits. Again the simplicity just blew me away. Back to the current menu, it was also very good. I am glad the "family style" concept of the previous chef is gone. I stopped going for a while as I found the dishes too hearty. A whole roast chicken? But they retained the antipasti spread which is nice. Based on past experiences, we found the food can be a bit too rich so we decided to share the dishes. It was a good thing too as we still could not finish our dishes. The pumpkin and mushroom risotto looked plain but it was full of flavor and was also cheesy. The fusili had plenty of real crab meat (in chunks so you do not have to search for it) and asparagus and was also a bit jelak (too rich) after a while. The only white pizza on the menu now had a cream base so it was not what I had in mind. We decided to get the Italiana which had buffalo mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes (very sweet and juicy) and arugula on it. This was equally delicious though I wished there were more of the mozzarella on it. Dessert was not as good compared to the mains. Maybe we should have stuck to gelato and tiramisu instead. The tiramisu is always good here. If you cannot decide what to have, the set dinner option is a good deal at $69 and it generally have pretty good dishes. I do think the prices are a bit on the high side, and it makes me wonder if it is catered to the FAR/AMEX card members where they can get discount of up to 50% (depending on number of diners).

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Looking at the other Yelpers reviews, I'd love to be back for the Sunday brunch buffet!Chanced upon this restaurant with a colleague's recommendation for a farewell of another. This place serves fresh food (oh I'm an absolute lover for fresh ingredients!). Set dinner comes with a "chef hat only" anti pasti + "chef hat only" pasta + chef daily special + dessert. "Chef hat only" cuz you can only select the items with the chef hat logo.We ordered a dinner set, and added on an anti pasti of foie gras and a pizza for 3 to share. We've got aged parma ham for anti pasti selection, a linguini (small serving size was served instead of its normal serving size for set dinner), and a tiramisu. Chef daily special was beef stew with carrots and roasted potatoes. As usual for an Italian dining, bread was served for appetizer with home made truffle butter! The truffle butter was delicious! Olive oil served upon request only.Aged parma ham was served with rock melon and it rocked. We were pretty surprised with the serving size of the linguini though, as it looked like a $5 pasta when served. Really.....Roasted foie gras and pizza (Rustica) was really nice and we totally enjoyed it.Dinner ended with a coffee, tea and tiramisu, and our night feels complete!Waiters are rather attentive to us at all times, despite the huge restaurant space they occupy! However, our orders for coffee and tea were forgotten twice and we gotta remind them.Spent about $$$$/$$$$$ and felt that it was worth it. We spent a great 2 hours quality time together enjoying great food!Till next visit!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: We came here on a Wednesday night as a party of 3, for a leisurely set dinner. Prices here a bit high on the à La Carte menu, but a friend had an Amex that had a substantial discount so find out more before you come here.I had the calamari (safe choice), mushroom penne, chef's special (beef stew), and the tiramisu. Nothing is spectacular here, but nothing is really bad too. An average place, with higher-than-average prices. Italian is not my favorite cuisine, so I may be biased, and it may take a bit more than Prego to impress my Italian-hating palate.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: One of my favourite Italian restaurants on the Red Dot. It's loud, it's vibrate, it's a place to just chill out with family and friends. The menu is well balanced from its antipasti to its mains of meats, pasta and pizza.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: had our dinner here over the weekend, and the pizzas were great. liked that the place is very accessible, and service was incredible too

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: This restaurant is located in the Fairmont. It okay but a bit disorganized. Service is mediocre. Price is premium.Lots of other food options in the mall attached to the hotel.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: This review is for the breakfast buffet.While conveniently located from the Fairmont hotel, this place just isn't up to their standards. The food and selection was above average for buffet standards, and had every ethnic cuisine known around Singapore, as well as some western items. Pretty much everything I tried was well-made.The layout is very confusing. It's in two divisions and you have to walk ~80ft to get to the other side to see what's there. The service is what really annoyed me. During a late breakfast, the whole service crew aggressively turns over the front of house for lunch. They were slamming glasses, chairs, plates, silverware, etc like as if they were on a time limit. By doing that, it pretty much tells the patrons to "get out", it's terribly loud and doesn't make for a relaxing breakfast. At the higher price of this place, you'd expect much better than that. I recommend Gastronomia Di Paolo or Tiong Bahru down the escalator instead.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Prego used to be my favorite Italian restaurant in Singapore :) I say used to because I havent been there for a while now, but I've always had good experiences there.I fondly remember the wild mushroom soup. Not too creamy, strong mushroom taste, smooth and not too heavy. The ravioli is deserving of mention too. However, the portion is a tad small, but that is pretty normal of ravioli orders.The braised lamb shank is usually beautifully cooked. Tender and juicy. Mm.Definitely leave some space for their signature Tiramisu. The $14 price tag doesnt come cheap, but it is well worth the price tag!If you have an Amex platinum card with the free far card gourmet membership, the discount is 50% for 2 diners, 33% for 3 diners, 25% for four diners and 20% for five diners and above. Pretty decent prices after the discount if you ask me!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Exceptionally convenient in The Fairmont Hotel, Prego is also our breakfast buffet restaurant while staying here. We ordered a  pizza, enough for two and quite good,  and an antipasto eggplant parmesean, also quite tasty! Italian atmosphere and decent food, good service, and reasonable prices make Prego a prime casual dining spot in Singapore.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: I was at Prego recently for lunch with my family and some family friends. The last time they went to Prego, they have such a bad experience they hadn't been back for almost more than 5 years.We were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was! The pizzas were not big but they were very well made, and the carbonara was pretty awesome. Portions were a little too small for the price, but generally a decent meal.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: For appetizers, we ordered Prosciutto di Pa Parma and Carpaccio di Manzo, and they were both delicious! If you're someone who enjoys tasting sweet and salty in one dish, Prosciutto di Pa Parma is for you. The sweet Rock Melon pairs well with the Parma Ham, leaving a clean aftertaste. The beef in Carpaccio di Manzo is thinly sliced and melts in your mouth, allowing you to fully enjoy the well seasoned dish. The mushrooms on Funghi Misti pizza were juicy and fragrant; the thin base and crust helped enhance the taste. Though it was delicious, the pizza seemed a bit overpriced.  The chicken in Pollo Arrosto were well roasted while maintaining its tenderness. It was also well accompanied by an array of grilled vegetables, making it a nutritious meal! Many people seemed to be celebrating their birthdays there so expect to hear (or perhaps join!) a couple of birthday songs.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Nice good food. Striploin, risotto, tiramisu recommended.Very friendly and helpful waitress (manager) by the name of Sharon.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: For a high end Italian restaurant I'd expect better service. The waiter can't remember who wanted warm or cold water. The waitress gave us white wine glasses for red wine.Food was good - I particularly enjoyed the grilled king prawns and their handmade strozzapreti. Don't order their supposedly "signature" tiramisu - not worth the calories. The kahlua mudpie was good though.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Went for Prego's Sunday Brunch with my family twice and I must say I love it to bits because of the buffet selection! Prego's brunch buffet changes depending on what they have during that season. The first time we went there, they were offering a selection of fresh fruit juice, foie gras and scallops as part of their buffet. Another time we went there, they had a breakfast selection of eggs benedict, scramble eggs and you can order fruits smoothie made fresh from the kitchen from your waitress (it is part of the buffet). The only things that remained unchanged were the cold cuts section which served parma ham, salami, capicola etc. There's also a nice selection of cheese and crackers next to the cold cuts. The salad section was fairly generous. I loved their salmon salad. They have a roast section where there's duck, beef cheeks, braised ox tail, pan grilled salmon, breaded calami rings etc. They have a seafood section where there's oysters, scallops, prawns and mussels. Of course, being an italian restaurant, they have a chef there to cook the pasta of your choice fresh for you. It's a family oriented restaurant where there's a children's section near the roast food section for kids to play, run around and eat at. The highlight of this place for me was their dessert section. Tiramisu, apple fritters fried before your eyes then sprinkled with brown sugar and caramel sauce served onto your plate warm, a mountain of chocolate profiteroles, chocolate mousse, vodka and wine jelly shots,  biscotti, ice cream, cheesecake, panna cotta, flan.. oh you name it, they have it. It's desserts heaven for a desserts lover like me. Prego's Sunday Brunch also offers champagne but it comes with an added cost to your total bill. The service was great as well. It is definitely worth a try if you are looking for a filling Sunday Brunch.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Came here for an impromptu lunch. Hardly visit Raffles City Shopping Centre when I was home but was so surprised how it has changed for the past decade or so. Not sure where to grab lunch so I decided to drop by Prego. Prego is located at the Fairmont hotel side. Staff would take my temperature after I scanned a QR code to check in for contact tracing.FOOD 5/5The spaghetti carbonara was really really good! Possibly the best I had in the past decades or ever. The bread that came before the meal was to die for. they looked like they made them in-house. I ended the lunch with an order of tiramisu. I already know how good that tiramisu was since I had room service while I was serving my stay home notice at Swissotel Stamford.SERVICE 5/5Staffs were wonderful and checked on me throughout the lunch. They were friendly too.AMBIENCE 5/5I suspect the last time I been to Prego was over a decade ago. They have probably renovated the restaurant many times since. The restaurant is beautiful and I love the decor especially that Fiat in the middle of the restaurant.Solid food, wonderful service with a beautiful ambience = Prego I would definitely return and check out more items the next time I am in Singapore!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Still an old time fave. This place holds memories of dates when I was at universities and family dinners. As well as time spent when I started my own family. Food and service is great. Of course you cannot beat the central location too!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Nice Italian place in the Fairmont. We really like the tiramisu here as it's right balance of boozy and coffee flavors. The other dishes are also decent and it's a huge place so you'll always get seating.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: We were in the area and decided to drop by for lunch as I remembered that I could enjoy 50% discount with AMEX credit card when dining for 2 persons. The staff took down my name before showing us to a table.After placing our orders, we were served bread with cream cheese in a wooden box and iced water. One could also enjoy the bread with vinegar or olive oil which was available in a bottle on the table.Prego Pizza ($38++)Mozzarella, Ham, Mushroom, Parmesan, Sundried Tomato, Fresh CreamThe pizza crust was thin and crispy, and cut easily. Although it looked thin, the filling was just nice.Agnolotti di Vitello al Sugo d' Arrosto ($36++)Confit Veal Ravioli, Veal Glace, Whipped Truffle CreamThe dish smelt quite nice of truffle. The ravioli was a tab hard. The filling was meaty and went quite well with the sauce.The place was packed during lunch. We did not wait long for the food to be served, although I wish that the water was refilled more often.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: If you are staying at the Fairmont, in the morning they have the breakfast buffet here for guest. They have quite an impressive spread of options in the morning, definitely something for everyone and was vegetarian friendly. Also had dinner here after a day full of exploring, I managed to crawl my tired legs here for food. The service was excellent and friendly, and the food was quite good. Whether its breakfast or a good pasta dinner you are in need of, this place has you covered.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: A great meal as always. I had the cod with baby potatoes. Hubby had grilled sea bass. For dessert I had a sinful caramel mousse with vanilla ice cream and an affogato mousse hidden under the ice cream. Hubby had a boring but good tiramisu  And check out the beautiful mosaic floor of the restaurant #maneklady #manekeats

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: The thing about Prego or any of the restaurants in Fairmont or Swissotel the Stamford is that the chef is only there for 2 years? Apparently they rotate the head chefs among their hotels worldwide to refresh the menu. But the staple or favorite dishes will remain. I was back there last night and discovered the new chef came in 3 months ago and the menu has been tweaked slightly. So certain items which my friend raved about were no longer there. So do go back often if you like a particular dish as it may not be around a few years later. My favorite dishes are a white pizza and cannolo dessert from a few years ago. I am hoping they will bring that back again. The white pizza was simply brushed with olive oil and herbs and topped with parma ham, mushrooms and cheese. So simple and so good. The cannolo was filled with sweet cream and served with a scoop of ice cream and fruits. Again the simplicity just blew me away. Back to the current menu, it was also very good. I am glad the "family style" concept of the previous chef is gone. I stopped going for a while as I found the dishes too hearty. A whole roast chicken? But they retained the antipasti spread which is nice. Based on past experiences, we found the food can be a bit too rich so we decided to share the dishes. It was a good thing too as we still could not finish our dishes. The pumpkin and mushroom risotto looked plain but it was full of flavor and was also cheesy. The fusili had plenty of real crab meat (in chunks so you do not have to search for it) and asparagus and was also a bit jelak (too rich) after a while. The only white pizza on the menu now had a cream base so it was not what I had in mind. We decided to get the Italiana which had buffalo mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes (very sweet and juicy) and arugula on it. This was equally delicious though I wished there were more of the mozzarella on it. Dessert was not as good compared to the mains. Maybe we should have stuck to gelato and tiramisu instead. The tiramisu is always good here. If you cannot decide what to have, the set dinner option is a good deal at $69 and it generally have pretty good dishes. I do think the prices are a bit on the high side, and it makes me wonder if it is catered to the FAR/AMEX card members where they can get discount of up to 50% (depending on number of diners).

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Looking at the other Yelpers reviews, I'd love to be back for the Sunday brunch buffet!Chanced upon this restaurant with a colleague's recommendation for a farewell of another. This place serves fresh food (oh I'm an absolute lover for fresh ingredients!). Set dinner comes with a "chef hat only" anti pasti + "chef hat only" pasta + chef daily special + dessert. "Chef hat only" cuz you can only select the items with the chef hat logo.We ordered a dinner set, and added on an anti pasti of foie gras and a pizza for 3 to share. We've got aged parma ham for anti pasti selection, a linguini (small serving size was served instead of its normal serving size for set dinner), and a tiramisu. Chef daily special was beef stew with carrots and roasted potatoes. As usual for an Italian dining, bread was served for appetizer with home made truffle butter! The truffle butter was delicious! Olive oil served upon request only.Aged parma ham was served with rock melon and it rocked. We were pretty surprised with the serving size of the linguini though, as it looked like a $5 pasta when served. Really.....Roasted foie gras and pizza (Rustica) was really nice and we totally enjoyed it.Dinner ended with a coffee, tea and tiramisu, and our night feels complete!Waiters are rather attentive to us at all times, despite the huge restaurant space they occupy! However, our orders for coffee and tea were forgotten twice and we gotta remind them.Spent about $$$$/$$$$$ and felt that it was worth it. We spent a great 2 hours quality time together enjoying great food!Till next visit!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: We came here on a Wednesday night as a party of 3, for a leisurely set dinner. Prices here a bit high on the à La Carte menu, but a friend had an Amex that had a substantial discount so find out more before you come here.I had the calamari (safe choice), mushroom penne, chef's special (beef stew), and the tiramisu. Nothing is spectacular here, but nothing is really bad too. An average place, with higher-than-average prices. Italian is not my favorite cuisine, so I may be biased, and it may take a bit more than Prego to impress my Italian-hating palate.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: One of my favourite Italian restaurants on the Red Dot. It's loud, it's vibrate, it's a place to just chill out with family and friends. The menu is well balanced from its antipasti to its mains of meats, pasta and pizza.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: had our dinner here over the weekend, and the pizzas were great. liked that the place is very accessible, and service was incredible too

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: This restaurant is located in the Fairmont. It okay but a bit disorganized. Service is mediocre. Price is premium.Lots of other food options in the mall attached to the hotel.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: This review is for the breakfast buffet.While conveniently located from the Fairmont hotel, this place just isn't up to their standards. The food and selection was above average for buffet standards, and had every ethnic cuisine known around Singapore, as well as some western items. Pretty much everything I tried was well-made.The layout is very confusing. It's in two divisions and you have to walk ~80ft to get to the other side to see what's there. The service is what really annoyed me. During a late breakfast, the whole service crew aggressively turns over the front of house for lunch. They were slamming glasses, chairs, plates, silverware, etc like as if they were on a time limit. By doing that, it pretty much tells the patrons to "get out", it's terribly loud and doesn't make for a relaxing breakfast. At the higher price of this place, you'd expect much better than that. I recommend Gastronomia Di Paolo or Tiong Bahru down the escalator instead.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Prego used to be my favorite Italian restaurant in Singapore :) I say used to because I havent been there for a while now, but I've always had good experiences there.I fondly remember the wild mushroom soup. Not too creamy, strong mushroom taste, smooth and not too heavy. The ravioli is deserving of mention too. However, the portion is a tad small, but that is pretty normal of ravioli orders.The braised lamb shank is usually beautifully cooked. Tender and juicy. Mm.Definitely leave some space for their signature Tiramisu. The $14 price tag doesnt come cheap, but it is well worth the price tag!If you have an Amex platinum card with the free far card gourmet membership, the discount is 50% for 2 diners, 33% for 3 diners, 25% for four diners and 20% for five diners and above. Pretty decent prices after the discount if you ask me!

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Exceptionally convenient in The Fairmont Hotel, Prego is also our breakfast buffet restaurant while staying here. We ordered a  pizza, enough for two and quite good,  and an antipasto eggplant parmesean, also quite tasty! Italian atmosphere and decent food, good service, and reasonable prices make Prego a prime casual dining spot in Singapore.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: I was at Prego recently for lunch with my family and some family friends. The last time they went to Prego, they have such a bad experience they hadn't been back for almost more than 5 years.We were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was! The pizzas were not big but they were very well made, and the carbonara was pretty awesome. Portions were a little too small for the price, but generally a decent meal.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: For appetizers, we ordered Prosciutto di Pa Parma and Carpaccio di Manzo, and they were both delicious! If you're someone who enjoys tasting sweet and salty in one dish, Prosciutto di Pa Parma is for you. The sweet Rock Melon pairs well with the Parma Ham, leaving a clean aftertaste. The beef in Carpaccio di Manzo is thinly sliced and melts in your mouth, allowing you to fully enjoy the well seasoned dish. The mushrooms on Funghi Misti pizza were juicy and fragrant; the thin base and crust helped enhance the taste. Though it was delicious, the pizza seemed a bit overpriced.  The chicken in Pollo Arrosto were well roasted while maintaining its tenderness. It was also well accompanied by an array of grilled vegetables, making it a nutritious meal! Many people seemed to be celebrating their birthdays there so expect to hear (or perhaps join!) a couple of birthday songs.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Nice good food. Striploin, risotto, tiramisu recommended.Very friendly and helpful waitress (manager) by the name of Sharon.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: For a high end Italian restaurant I'd expect better service. The waiter can't remember who wanted warm or cold water. The waitress gave us white wine glasses for red wine.Food was good - I particularly enjoyed the grilled king prawns and their handmade strozzapreti. Don't order their supposedly "signature" tiramisu - not worth the calories. The kahlua mudpie was good though.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Went for Prego's Sunday Brunch with my family twice and I must say I love it to bits because of the buffet selection! Prego's brunch buffet changes depending on what they have during that season. The first time we went there, they were offering a selection of fresh fruit juice, foie gras and scallops as part of their buffet. Another time we went there, they had a breakfast selection of eggs benedict, scramble eggs and you can order fruits smoothie made fresh from the kitchen from your waitress (it is part of the buffet). The only things that remained unchanged were the cold cuts section which served parma ham, salami, capicola etc. There's also a nice selection of cheese and crackers next to the cold cuts. The salad section was fairly generous. I loved their salmon salad. They have a roast section where there's duck, beef cheeks, braised ox tail, pan grilled salmon, breaded calami rings etc. They have a seafood section where there's oysters, scallops, prawns and mussels. Of course, being an italian restaurant, they have a chef there to cook the pasta of your choice fresh for you. It's a family oriented restaurant where there's a children's section near the roast food section for kids to play, run around and eat at. The highlight of this place for me was their dessert section. Tiramisu, apple fritters fried before your eyes then sprinkled with brown sugar and caramel sauce served onto your plate warm, a mountain of chocolate profiteroles, chocolate mousse, vodka and wine jelly shots,  biscotti, ice cream, cheesecake, panna cotta, flan.. oh you name it, they have it. It's desserts heaven for a desserts lover like me. Prego's Sunday Brunch also offers champagne but it comes with an added cost to your total bill. The service was great as well. It is definitely worth a try if you are looking for a filling Sunday Brunch.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Service was very slow.  Lasagna was very good.   Waitress uninformed with wine selection but graciously worked the up sell to us.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: I went here last Sunday for dinner - and wanted to just have a light nosh - but ended up getting more - as I couldn't help myself! As we walked, I noticed how homey and done up the place looked. The service was spot on, with the staff greeting us at the entrance with enthusiasm and smiles. We were ushered to a nice table, and the waitress, pushed a wine cart to our table and served us wine immediately! Was like she read our minds! Hahah. We got a meat & cheese platter and a salad, which was yummmy.What I Love: Service was amazing. The menu was cool and I loved the meat and cheese platter they served. Wine was great. Ambiance was perfect. It's romantic, nice and has a nice vibe.What I Don't Love: Price. What we had came up to $130ish? But with a MasterCard, there was a 20% discount - which was amazing. Brought the bill down a bit. Do prepare to spend $50-$80 pax.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Overpriced but worth every penny. Home made pasta are to die for here and since this place is so big, you hardly have to wait to get a table even if you don't have a reservation. To top that, City Hall MRT is right next door that it's convenient to come here. And after, check out New Asia Bar at Swiss Hotel next door.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: I go to Singapore at least once a quarter. This restaurant is in the Hotel Fairmont, where I normally stay. Since there are so many great and interesting places to eat for lunch and dinner, I only go here for breakfast. It is very enjoyable, with a huge selection, from continental European to traditional English to Asian and Indian specialties. Services is good, food is excellent, and it's easy to get in and out quickly. I did try for dinner twice and found it to be good, if unspectacular.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Unsuspecting hotel guests: this place commits daylight robbery at dinner time. I was invited for dinner, balked at the prices, but thought the quality and quantity of food would match the prices. Water alone was $3. After I got home, I raided the fridge for food as I was still hungry. I could not bring myself to take a photo of the $28 Grilled Octopus that I ordered. It consisted of 7 pieces of sliced octopus the size of a US quarter coin and 4 cubes of sweet potato on a dry bed of shaved fennel, probably days old because it was tasteless and bone dry. The menu says it would come with Salsa Verde but the whole dish was dry and flavorless. I couldn't take a photo of the dish when it arrived because I felt it would have been offensive to my host--there was obviously nothing to warrant a photo. Nor a return visit.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Part of the Fairmont Hotel, Prego has a consistently good kitchen and the menu varies in so many ways thet everybody will find something delicious!The quality and service are always great, service is considerably speedy. The pricing is a bit off the chart I find but this might have to do with the fact that it belongs to the hotel.Parking is obviously easy as it's connected to Raffles City mall, alternatively if you use MRT go to City Hall station.Another thing this has has going for itself is the decor and lighting. It makes me really comfortable for some reason, like a market style. It's fun!Enjoy peeps!-S :)

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Tres over-rated. Service is passable for the prices, but there are plenty of better Italian resto options in town.

address: 80 Bras Basah Rd Level 1 Singapore 189560 Singapore
comment: Prego has been a stalwart on the Italian mid/fine dining scene for ages, and it's no surprise. The food is consistently good, and the menu refreshed frequently enough to keep even long time regulars coming back for more.The service is also genuine and efficient, which helps a lot. Located in the Fairmont Hotel, one is greeted with the happy sight of a deli with cured meats and cheeses. The dining area is a large but still intimate place with the right amount of everything, such that it would be equally good for a romantic casual date in the evening, and very fitting as well for a serious business lunch on week days.The choices offered in the two daily lunch sets are spot on: a quick panini + soup/salad set, or a more hearty three course chef's menu that hits the spot if you're a little hungrier.

address: 17 Stamford Road #02-06 & #03-06, Capitol Singapore Singapore 178907 Singapore
comment: Sing with me Da hilllllls are aaaallliivveeee With the sound of fooodies Where soda comes in apple strudel flavouuur Da hills are allliiive With the sound of foodies Where duck papardelle and sausages remain supreme Drop the beat down Food: good Atmosphere : awesome but no twirling Service : no nuns or singing groups... But attentive nonetheless

address: 17 Stamford Road #02-06 & #03-06, Capitol Singapore Singapore 178907 Singapore
comment: Cuisine from Central European countries such as Austria, Czech Republic and Hungary!Based on the recommendation of another online review, I decided to check out the place in the newly restored Capitol Building. The restaurant is inspired by the 16th century Habsburg Empire, which encompasses current day countries such as Austria, Bosnia, Czech Republic, Hungary, and Northern Italy.It wasn't particularly easy to find as the restaurant is located on the 2nd and 3rd floors above the entrance to the theater. It took a while to figure out where the elevator/escalator to the 2nd floor was located. Upon entry, I observed the rather grand decor with plush seating and gold plated looking ornaments.I went for couple of Austrian options like Austria's "national" dish, Wiener Schnitzel (the breaded veal version), the Kasekrainer (Austrian Pork Cheese Sausages) and Tafelspitzsulze Beef Aspic. The Wiener Schnitzel is one of the better ones that I've tried, rather crisp on the outside and moist on the inside, but one of the pieces was a tad bit drier than expected. The sausages were also pretty good, nicely grilled, but bordered on overly salty. The sauerkraut and potatoes were tasty and not sour, it pretty much beat any version served up by the other German and central European restaurants in Singapore.Executive Chef Hans Lüftenegger (formerly at Brotzeit) and Executive Pastry Chef Patrick helm the kitchen, and the quality of the food shows. The restaurant also serves a large selection of pastries displayed in a glass case, and "Zaunerstollen" from the Austrian patisserie Zauner (wafers coated in chocolate), and coffee from Julius Meinl. The chocolate cake was heavenly...The restaurant seemed to be moderately filled with customers, but I'm wondering if there's mass appeal in serving Austrian/Hungarian food that the crowd may not be familiar with. Competition is tough in the restaurant scene here. I'm impressed that they stuck to the theme and this is a rare find for cuisine in Singapore. I had a good dinner and I hope to be back for a second visit to try the rest of the items on the menu.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: Dropped in here in a Saturday evening for a bite to eat and a drink. The burger was amazing and there's a great selection of drinks too, prices weren't too bad and the staff were really friendly. Music was on point and the atmosphere was generally pretty great. Strong recommend!

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: after a week of business dinners and lunches, eating Thai, Chinese, Singaporean, Malaysian and Indian fare, on my last night I just wanted to eat alone, sit at a bar and have a burger and a beer.  This place hits on all those cylinders.kind of a hipster vibe, but not pretentious like the San Francisco hipsters I'm used to :) the burgers are great, the beer selection was not extensive but entirely serviceable, and the waitstaff was friendly, but not trying to become bffs with you. I will be back in Singapore a lot and and already looking forward to sneaking away to have a burger here.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: Hidden in one of the streets that runs along the back of Raffles Hotel are some really cool hole in the wall bars, in particular this one. Okay, I was looking for another bar but unfortunately that was closed, however this one was just down the road so I decided to check it out. I must say that I am really glad I did because this was one pretty cool bar. In fact it reminded me of some of the cool hole in the wall bars that you have in Melbourne. The staff are absolutely lovely, and the drinks are also quite reasonably priced as well. However I really liked the ambience of this place, while not grungy, still very laid back and relax. My recommend forget Raffles and come around the corner to this place because the drinks are much cheaper, the atnosphere much more laid back, and the staff super nice.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: Good burgers, cold beer, nice casual setting.Came in for a late dinner and was pleased with the quick and friendly service and the tasty burger. Not the healthiest place to eat, but great for burgers and bar type snacks. Will definitely return when in need of a burger.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: Outstanding cold beer - they saw me wandering around... offered to open up early and pour me the 4:45 pm beer, friendly about it too.  Well done Singapore - service who would have thought.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: This place is right across from Raffles Hotel. Lots of local young professionals go here for a drink after work. The chalkboard is full of specials and happy hour details, and they play American 80's rock like Nirvana.We go for the beer and the burgers.  The burgers range from $12-$16 and come with fries or onion rings. You can upsize to parmesan truffle fries for $2, which is what I always do.  There are different variations of burgers, such as-a Mexican burger with chili-the breakfast burger with chorizo and egg-Swiss cheese & mushroom burger (a more conservative choice)The appetizers like the chicken wings also seem very popular. We like it for the casual vibe, the fact that prices are net (no ++ here!), and the happy hours don't end too early. Price is always reasonable when we pay up.Free water for the non-drinkers a plus.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: For Singapore prices, reasonably-priced burgers. I reckon they're a medium size: enough to satisfy, but not so much I was left feeling full. The French fries were pretty parsimonious to be honest, but the wedges were a bit more substantial for the price. And we were able to get the toppings on-the-side (American style) with no difficulty, which I thought was good. The burger buns were white sesame-seed buns, toasted nicely, and not just warmed, and so had a satisfying crunch to them. My meat pattie was medium-rare. I would prefer to have a choice and get it medium. Perhaps I did have that choice? But it wasn't an option on the menu and I wasn't asked. Unless I can't count, my double-pattie (super cheesy burger) was only a single pattie. The man taking our orders was pleasant enough, but the lady who delivered our burgers just plonked them on the table with nary a word or explanation of which was which until we asked her.All in all, I'd happily come here again for a burger fix. Only thing to be aware of its that the menu is apparently new, and right now they don't have the salad available.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: good enough beer.  don't like my burger pre-seasoned,  and it was...to the point of overpowering  the beef.  onion rings looked and tasted fast foodish...yuck.  service was good.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: I'm reluctant to post a review, since this is my Singapore hideout where I can let my hair down, be myself, and always have a seat at.  I love the easy vibe of the place; a bar where you'll find unpretentious creative-minded frequenters: chefs, filmmakers, directors, writers, YouTubers, musicians... It's the kind of place where everyone gets to know the affable owners Pio and Adam - likely through a game of beer pong they'll challenge you to - a place where everyone knows your name (Cheers, anyone?). The Messy Mexican Burger (chili bacon burger) is one of my favorite sloppy joe style burgers in town.

opening: [('Mon', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Tue', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Wed', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Thu', ['5:00 PM - 1:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Fri', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sat', ['5:00 PM - 3:00 AM (Next day)']), ('Sun', ['Closed'])]
comment: Damn fine burger actually. Singapore you continue to impress. Lively crowd and good easy laid back vibe. Wanted to go for the burger with egg and probably will next time. Not sure it will live up to Squirrels in Corvallis Oregon, but willing to give it a go. Never lived until you have had a squirrel burger. No, no squirrels had to die.

Coming from LA, I was a bit skeptical about eating here because the gyu kaku in LA isn't so good. Cheap, okay quality meat. Upon coming here, I was extremely surprised to see a totally upgraded menu with good quality meats and a variety of dishes. Ordered so much for four people, we could barely finish everything. Australian wgayu platter $230- rib eye, rump cap, sirloin, tongue, etc... Everything was amazing. Melt in your mouth goodness. So much fat and tenderness and flavor...Japanese A3 wgayu- surprisingly not as tender as the Australian. Maybe because it's a3? Still extremely tender though, and more flavor. I actually liked this one better. Seafood platter- pretty full by this point. Comes with giant prawns, scallops, salmon, oysters. It was decent, the prawn was the best. Maybe it wasn't as good because I was already extremely full?Also got the banchan, mushrooms, fried rice, and ice cream to top off the meal. All great compliments to the meal. Overall, best gyu kaku meal I've had. Everything was top notch quality, and it's really difficult to find this type of quality in la. Yum. I am salivating thinking about this meal. Definitely giving gyu kaku in other countries a chance!

Imported Japanese wagyu self-grilled over charcoal. Various cuts of fresh meat are available. In contrast to over-marinated kbbq, yakiniku are unseasoned, thus you can taste the quality of a good cut of meat easily. A good dish to start is the 190g trial platter, which consist of an array of meat cuts. Also worth mentioning was the extremely fragrant garlic fried rice, as well as the juicy kurobuta belly. I would recommend a reservation as the place gets filled fast on Friday/Saturday nights. Definitely worth the occasional splurge.

It is difficult to believe this is a chain restaurant.If you do not like meat, you might not like Gyu Kaku.Japanese BBQ.If you do like meat, you will probably like Gyu Kaku Japanese BBQ.I love meat, so I love Gyu Kaku Japanese BBQ.The ambiance is nice.  It is dark.  it is not extravagant but it does have a classic touch to the space.In general, I am a fan of places where you are eating and cooking. This was just a meat-fest; sausage, beef, lamb, pork belly, tongue and more.   It was all  there.  It was all very good.tinyurl.com/8bwahbstinyurl.com/8dt35rxThere was kimchi, a small cucumber dish and a spinach salad.   I am not a huge kimchi fan but this was pretty good.  The spinach salad was very good.tinyurl.com/8k4ysk4tinyurl.com/94vybk9tinyurl.com/8bpjyd8The fried rice was AAA.  It was fried table-side.tinyurl.com/9nggnbjThere was even a little sorbet for dessert.tinyurl.com/8gker2uThe service was friendly and helpful  They changed the grill cover often.  They were very willing to answer questions and they checked in frequently.I will definitely return and would not hesitate to try their other outlets in other locations local and abroad.

Good food, great service and lots of fun, Gyu Kaku is a nice place to have gatherings and enjoy food. Promising an authentic teppanyaki experience, which they pulled off with gusto, Gyu Kaku prides itself on the excellent service together with the freshest ingredients. The wagyu beef is absolutely juicy and well marbled and grilled to perfection. They do a pretty good job with the greens as well, providing a fresh tasting accompaniment to the meats. The ambience was great and though its great for gatherings with large groups of friends (I was there with 6 others), I spotted more couples than groups, which is oddly surprising as I don't find it really romantic.

I was leaving Chijmes with a friend after a business meeting when we walked by this restaurant. Feeling like Japanese BBQ, we decided to have dinner here. It was an authentic Teppanyaki, albeit pricy, meal. The meats were juicy and so, so fresh. If you're here, try the aburi bacon. Don't leave the veggies sidelined; the assorted mushrooms with butter were my favourite accompaniment to the meaty selection. Not much of a chef? Don't worry, they recommend combinations of seasoning for your food. Everything I had went well with Asahi. Service was great, as is usually expected from Japanese culture. The ambience was nice too. We ended up staying there for almost three hours, just the two of us. I'm definitely coming back here, perhaps this time with my foodie family.

My coworkers and I (3 of us total) just had dinner at Gyu Kaku. and I would like to report that we all had a very enjoyable meal.I have visited the Chicago location of Gyu Kaku on MANY occasions (10+) when working there - so I had high expectations of this place before coming in to the Singapore location.Based on the menu, our party ordered the Fuku Set and were pleased with it. As choice of salad, we requested the Wakame (Seaweed) Salad. All of our cuts of meat, Aburi Bacon, Wagyu Fillet Steak, Wagyu Karubi, Wagyu Rump Cap, Kurobuta Pork Collar, Duck Breast - were well marinated and delicious.The highlights for me would definitely be:- Wagyu Fillet Steak- Duck Breast- Wagyu KarubiThe service was good - offering to mix the rice for us, sort salads and change the grill. This is consistent with the level of service I've found at the Chicago location. I would definitely try to make it back here before I leave Singapore.

Last week I went to Gyu-Kaku at Chijmes for the first time, and it was a great experience!We ordered the premium platter that comes with a variety of different wagyu beef parts. We also ordered more plates of wagyu beef, pork belly and chicken. A waitress took the initiative to barbecue everything for us! Everything was cooked perfectly. When I bit into the beef it was slightly charred on the outside but sooo tender on the inside, bursting with beef juices.It was also my first time eating beef tongue, and it was quite delicious!! I'm not sure if that's because it is wagyu beef, but it tasted so juicy and flavorful and tongue-like actually...but maybe that's psychological.Also, the kimchi soup was the best kimchi soup I've ever had!!!! It's really delicious and a must-try if you love spicy food!! It wasn't too sour like how kimchi usually is, it was more sweet and was served piping hot!I guess the only downside is that it is quite expensive, but honestly you are paying for what you get! If you really have the money to splurge then it is worth it, especially if you like beef.Great ambience, great service and great food!! Overall for 5 people the bill came up to more than $500.Check out my blog (in my profile) for photos :)

This is the price that I am willing to pay for some good authentic Japanese barbeque! If you like Japanese barbeque, you will fall in love with this place. I love the beef here. Juicy, succulent, fresh and tender! The pork is equally good, with many parts of the pig to choose from. Out of curiosity, I also tried the beef tongue. They have a special dip to get rid of the 'bad smell', if any. The texture was pretty special, but the taste wasn't too very outstanding. One thing to note, the price is actually not very friendly to your pocket. It'd probably burn a hole! But for the good food you are paying, outstanding service and environment, I guess it's okay to be nice to yourself occasionally.

very nice, delicious food but light on the volume..if you are really hungry plan on spending alot.  Also the staff's English (fairly) wasn't that great so expect a bit of back and forth, but worth it for the quality

Had my birthday dinner here on a weekday. Service staff were great. Never seen people serve food with so much enthusiasm and smiles before, so this was excellent! The ambience was nice and relaxed, music was good and not too loud. We had the Hokkaido scallops, Gnocchi and Taglierini. And I'm no food critic but all I can say is that it was delicious and we enjoyed it and the whole experience.

As this was close by our hotel (JW Marriott) we thought a quick stop by for a drink and snack was in order.  Our server Bjorn was an excellent host and guided us through our drink selections along with snacks of preference.  Nothing disappointed. an excellent sports bar with plenty of TV's for different selections and a good time atmosphere prevailed.
Amazing service and great food. I recommend for lunch and dinner. The desserts are also fabulous.
super fresh food and service was very attentive.  also had a nice selection of wines by the glass.  good breeze if you grab a table outside.

Our first Time here at the Capitol Kempinski Hotel and their new one year old restaurant 15 Stamford Road by 3 Michelin Star  Chef Alvin Leung.  The reservation for dinner for two at 6:00 pm on Sunday night to celebrate Chinese New Year 2020 in Singapore.  I have always wanted to taste Singapore and what better way than to stay at this Leading Hotel of the World Heritage site in Singapore at 15 Stamford Road.From the beginning to the end of our Fine dining experience at 15 Stamford Road restaurant everyone and everything was flowing freely and so many guest having a wonderful experience tonight.We ordered a la carte tonight and made a Feast of unforgettable dishes to remember for life.  The Red King Crab leg was so fresh and delicious.  The Linguine Har Mi prawns firm and spicy  with rich creamy coconut sauce.  The Lamb loin with tender neck meat was simply divine!!All the vegetables dishes was served fresh and perfectly cooked and seasoned tonight.  I really had such a wonderful experience here and truly would recommend you visit 15 Stamford Road to taste the difference today.Finally dessert was a rare gem of sherry with freshly made vanilla ice cream with one strawberry.  Our sommelier was quite knowledgeable and  recommend this wine selection for dessert tonight.  He was very helpful with cleaning up the table to prepare us for dessert.   Thank you everyone here tonight for a truly outstanding experience  at 15 Stamford Road by Alvin Leung.

What an elegant restaurant, to someone who misses Singapore, the interior was the exact dreamy exotic feeling I seek. I met with my JC classmate for lunch it's been a few years since we saw each other. We had the 3 course set lunch. My glass of rose was fantastic! The courses were very tasty, featuring local flavors but in a technical way. First course was Yellowtail Amberjack, Laksa Oil, Soy, Ginger, Lime Gel, second course was Atlantic Cod, Little Neck Clam, Lemongrass,Coconut, Foie Gras Sauce and the last course was Yeung Ji Kam Lu' Mango, Sago, Pomelo, Coconut Snow. Absolutely loved the dessert! Love to hang out at the bar next time for a drink.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: We had a craving for sushi and this place filled it. PROS: Sushi/Sashimi: tuna, salmon, eel, yellowtail.            Teriyaki steak            Butter clams            Karage Chicken            CONS: Iced lemon tea was in a can.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: Sushi Tei was my favorite conveyor belt sushi chain! They've always had a good variety of dishes, not just sushi and sashimi! The kid and I decided to try stuff we don't usually get to eat back home so we focused on the seasonal menu. We were bummed that the crispy chicken skins and fish skins and other goodies were sold out! Everything we ordered were decent enough and came out really fast, except for the last two things we ordered-- the spicy tuna salad temaki and the soft shell crab roll with pork floss-- which took 20 minutes, and only was brought after I inquired. I was considering canceling both when they came. And then, the same waitress brought another temaki and asked how many I ordered.  Bill for both of us was $73! Return the wet wipes or they'll charge you.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: Good quality sashimi and sushi.We always have the dobin mushi, a nice clear soup with seafood and chicken served in a small teapot. We can highly recommend. Quick service. Order via iPads.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: A perennial favorite chain of mine for consistency and decent tasting Japanese food. I usually go for the grilled salmon head but since there's a seasonal special for a medai nitsuke, which loosely translates into red snapper braised in a sweet soy mirin sauce, described to be with gelatinous skin and bits, I was sold. Truth to be told, I was disappointed by the size of the head. Seemed much smaller than pictured. Taste wise, it was spot on. I enjoyed it despite the meat was a little tough and overcooked as the fish tasted fresh.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: The food Nothing out of the ordinary or too fancy. A Good, fast & efficient japanese franchise at affordable prices. What we had... 1. Salmon Yoridori - Ok 2. Niku Ramen - Great! 3. Hotate Toji Soba - Ok 4. Sashimi Salad - Great! Get the sushi tei dressing to go with it. It came with an assortment of slides of raw fish salmon, tuna etc... 5. Ton Curry Udon with pork cutlet - Ok. The udon was nice but I thought the pork was a little too dry. 6. Chicken Katsu don - Great! Although, they chicken cutlet could be a little less fatty. Overall, great for gatherings with friends :) this one is a little fancier in terms of deco, compared to most of its other franchises. Pricing wise, seems the same. Might even be good for a date - fancy ambiance (dimly lit too) at an affordable price :)

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: Sushi Tei serves well.. sushi.. and other Japanese food. If you were to ask me to point out anything special about it, I would say the sushi is definitely a nicer and brighter shade than Sakae Sushi. To be fair though, I am quite partial to Sushi Tei's cha soba (green tea) and their gindara. This time though, I decided to try this curious (ok maybe to the Japanese it's like a typical meal) looking dish with raw tuna, a half boiled egg and lots of spring onions. Pardon me if you are Japanese and the way I handled this dish is completely wrong, but to me I took it as a sign that this dish is meant to be mixed Pepper Lunch style. I mixed it all up and sprinkled glorious Japanese chilli flakes all over and begun the meal. Like all mixed up dishes.. it was delicious. I loved how the tuna meat, spring onions and egg gelled the rice together. Though my way of eating this dish may be wrong, it still is a dish worth a try! If you don't want to risk looking like a total fool (since the method of eating this dish may be wrong), stick to the Cha Soba.. you can't go wrong with dunking green tea noodle in a cup of its ice-cold broth.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: I like Sushi Tei for their fresh sushi and salads. For this outlet, what's really cool is when you enter through their extended walkway, you could have a table where it's like a cubicle - it's all the way inside and you have to walk through the bar, the tables, the booths, to finally get to the section where it's just private cubicles. Eating there is personal, comfy and intimate.What I Love: Their service. They are swift and prompt. Their Wakame Salad is yummy. Cha Soba serving is huge. Tip: If you're having the Cha Soba, do no order anything else. Their Green Tea is freshly brewed. Agedashi Tofu is totally yumminess. All their meat options are really yummy, so try everything! I also love that they have the Unagi and Teriyaki sweet sauce on every table. Usually, I have to request for that. For dessert, try their Ice Ball.What I Don't Love: Nothing! :)

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: Maybe this outlet just doesnt like me very much. The times I've been here, I'v been slightly disappointed with the service and food quality.Most recently, I ordered the sukiyaki but the contents of the pot were a little disappointing. It seemed like they simply chopped and dumped a load of vegetables inside and I struggled to find any noodles/golden mushrooms in the mix. I was there about 3 in the afternoon and they waitresses didnt seem best pleased that they had to serve customers at that time. Hmmm.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: This Sushi Tei outlet has space for more 'private' dining as compared to the other outlets, making the ambience here a bit more romantic and classy. However, as the 'private' area is slightly segregated from the main space, waiters may not hop over as often.No difference between the quality of food here and the other outlets.Recommend the Salmon Sashimi with Sushi Tei dressing which is a good appetizer / starter or can even function as a full meal if you're not a big eater. If you like shellfish, go for the hotate miso mayo that's basically mussels baked in a cheesy-mayo sauce. Other things to try here are the dragon roll, curry cutlet rice, beef sukiyaki, cawanmushi, and special unagi roll that comes with thick slabs of grilled eel.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #03-13/14 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: I was seriously impressed on my first visit to this Japanese restaurant by the overall décor and classy ambience. You are led to the seating area via a raised wooden platform with dimmed lighting and bamboo archways, making us feel like super VIPs! There is also more privacy offered to patrons with little booths that are sectioned off as well, which is always a good thing. The food itself is above average, with a wide range of delicious sushi platters with great combinations like lobster meat with avocado, or sashimi with mango slices. It may sound out of the ordinary, but tastes fresh and yummy. My favourite dish is their salads, mainly because I love their Wafu sauces that they drizzle atop the vegetables. It isn't too salty but still gives flavor to the otherwise bland raw veggies, but most importantly, isn't full of calories like Western sauces such as Thousand Island or Balsamic Vinegar. It is quite pricey though, so I can't really visit it as often as I would like.

I came here with another Yelper on a Friday night, and there was really no need to make reservations as the place wasn't filled. I got the Irish dry-aged topped with foie gras, which was done perfectly, unlike hers (see Catharina Ip's review for her experience). We also had mushrooms and asparagus sides, which were also done well. They have a good selection of beef here - I like!We did not order dessert, but was given a complimentary one as they had gotten her order wrong. All in all, a good experience for me. I have to say that for the 50% off mains with the Amex Plat card, I feel there is good value there. If I had to pay full price, I don't think I would return.

Let me first say that I find all steakhouses in Singapore expensive but I find Long Bar Steak house just not worth it. I ordered the Omaha Rib-eye with foie gras as extra, bearnaise sauce and asparagus with sun dried tomatoes as a side. First of all, I ordered my steak rare and when it arrived it was everything but rare but I must admit, this was immediately corrected by the staff and they gave us a complimentary dessert so I will not hold that against them.The main reason for rating them 3-stars is that I was very underwhelmed by the food. Don't get me wrong, it was certainly not bad but when I pay close to 200$ a person, I want to be wow-ed and I was not. The steak and foie were (once corrected) executed correctly, the sides were also ok but nothing really extraordinary. The bearnaise was rather disappointing, I do agree that the steak was of decent quality, so it did not really need extra sauce, but I believe if you serve it, you should make sure it is good. Also, the dessert, while free, was nothing special.In addition, I found the staff, while friendly, not very pro-active, I had to ask several times to top up my water glass and in general, it was difficult to waive them down, even though the place was not very busy.Next time I have a craving for steak and saved up some cash, most likely, I will take it somewhere else.  PS: This is another rather disappointing restaurant in the Raffles hotel, I am starting to think that this magnificent hotel has really seen his best days.

Fine dining place with excellent service. They have a sommelier who will give you proper advice on wines based on your budget and taste. Go for the proper marbled beef, leaner cuts are ordinary. You pay for what you get. Coffee and tea is hotel standard, $12.50 for each serving of coffee.

I regularly go to Raffles Hotel for my quick fix of cakes or a quiet read at their courtyard on days that aren't too sunny. But this was my first time at the Long Bar Steakhouse and boy, I was definitely impressed. I had myself a Caesar with smoked salmon for an appetizer, and for a starter, it was huge! I'm not too impressed with it as a whole but, Caesar can't really be elevated much - I did appreciate that they were really generous with the smoked salmon. By the time I finished half my salad, I was quite stuffed! The main was a Filet Mignon, rare. I would've tried blue but I wasn't too confident (nothing to do with LBSH, just many failed attempts at blue from other renowned steakhouses has left me scarred). But, I think even Gordon Ramsay would approve of the colour of the steak. It was nicely salted, I would recommend that if you choose the Steakhouse Butter (think that's the name), you can take it off the top of your steak after a bit. It does add to the flavour but, might make it a tad too salty. And of course, I ordered a foie gras to add to the cut. O.M.G. if you have never had steak and foie gras together in the same mouthful before, you need to try it. At least once. Trust me. Of course they taste just as great when apart - though I would've liked my foie gras slightly more seared, it was perfectly fatty and creamy. I'm a huge fan of fries, but my partner recommended the mash instead - ohmy. it was buttery and creamy - though, I would've loved it to be slightly more creamy, but it was a small thing that doesn't change my liking for it. I wasn't too impressed but the sautéed spinach, but that's probably cause I like creamed spinach more. (Yes, I think there is a trend, I like creamy stuff.)Dessert, was a tangy lemon tart with raspberry sorbet. It was definitely yummy - I cannot tell you how awesome the little lemon peaks were. The tart was a little too sweet on its own but paired with everything, including the sorbet, the flavours just melt together. OMNOM. Definitely will be back, sometime in the future.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #B1-60 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: HANDS DOWN MY FAVOURITE SALAD STORE. I actually visit this place at least once a week, which is pretty darn often considering that 1) my lunches are confined to the area around my workplace (which is not City Hall) and 2) I have dinner out 2-3 times a week on average. Walked by this place and the Caesar Salad addict in me just had to stop and try their version. WHICH IS THE BEST EVER. For $10 you get a huge bowl overflowing with toppings! One thing about them is that they are super generous with the chicken (which comes included in the usual recipe and not one of those "add meat for $4" deals)... In fact towards the end of my meal it was all chicken+other toppings in my bowl. Oh and their romaine lettuce is really fresh too!I tried adding more toppings for the first time today and was super impressed with the large portions... mushrooms cost $0.50 and they scooped out a sizable amount onto my mixing bowl... was impressed but then the guy scooped the same portion A SECOND TIME! :O Their wraps are pretty good too (and seem more popular than the salads themselves)... well actually their wraps are just their salads in a tortila but ANYWAY... I have problems finishing a salad on its own so I hardly get the wraps, but the one time I tried it- it was also super super super good!Okay I should really stop waxing lyrical about salads now but really please go to this place and keep it alive!

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #B1-60 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: Overall I like the healthy focused menu. The options are ok. I've tried many things on the menu and jotting really stands out. Also as the day gets later you can tell some of the options get a bit old such as the avocado. Bottom line..ok place for a healthy salad or wrap. It's convenient if you are in the mall. Expect basic service and mediocre food quality ProsHealthy options Fast service Cons Salad quality is ok Options are ok but nothing that stands out

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #B1-60 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: Good choice for the menu, and good variety of food to add. However, I was disappointed when I ordered the chili crab seafood wrap, that the meat tasted pretty cold and so did the rest of the wrap. It didn't seem grilled at all and the sauce was basically pouring out and food quality/taste was just okay. I'll still order from here though because it's convenient.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #B1-60 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: I first came across Simply Wraps at 100AM Mall on Tras St which is their first and only other location. The only reason I tried them in the first place was because I was starving and no other eatery in that mall appealed to me. I ordered the Martian's Delight and was delighted to find that it was the best salad wrap I've ever had. (Martian's Delight: romaine lettuce, roasted mango chicken, pumpkin, cherry tomatoes, carrots, cucumber, wasabi mayo dressing. I'll usually have it in a spinach wrap.)I'm hardly in the Tanjong Pagar area so I was delighted to hear they would be opening their 2nd outlet at Raffles City. I've been coming to this location regularly since they opened in Jan and simply love it. My only gripe, the portion of mango chicken in the wrap seems to be getting smaller. $9.90 is not cheap for a salad wrap so wish they'd be a tad more generous. The last time I went, I asked for a double portion of mango chicken for an extra $2.50. On a related note, I am always delighted when served by one particular preparer at this location because he always tops up the mango chicken if he thinks the first preparer has been a little too stingy.5 out of 10 times I'm at Raffles City now I'll eat here as I'm trying to get more greens into my diet.This is a must try for you salad & wrap affictionados and Subway-alternative seekers.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #B1-60 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: This is my new favorite go-to salad place in Singapore. The salads/wraps are fresh and they have a good selection of ingredients to choose from. It's also reasonably priced at S8.90 for six basic non-protein toppings. They also have fresh juices but I've never tried them before. What I like best is their service - the Filipino aunties are always smiley and friendly. (Go to the Cedele a few stores down, and you'll see what I mean.) Overall, a great place to grab a quick lunch/dinner if you're in the area.

address: 252 North Bridge Rd #B1-60 Raffles City Shopping Centre Singapore 179103 Singapore
comment: even meatless-salad-wraps are grilled. they managed to pull this off in a way that imparts the toasty grilled tortilla flavor, but also leaves the veggies crisp and cool. salad-haters will not approve.

Very nicely decorated food court.To even call this a food court is probably an understatement. This is nicer then a food court. The food is prepared in a nice ambiance, self served or collected with a beeper.Food quality can be disputed depending whether if you are comparing with a normal food court or a food cafe/restaurant type. It probably stands in between for value and quality.

address: 76 Bras Basah Rd Level 2 Singapore 189558 Singapore
comment: Prominent Cantonese restaurant in town area. As a kid, I used to visit Wah Lok on every family celebration occasions including dim sums.  However in recent years, the standard/quality has dropped and became more expensive.  I'd recommend Asia Grand instead.

address: 76 Bras Basah Rd Level 2 Singapore 189558 Singapore
comment: This place is nice, but way overpriced. The dim sum is very average. I'm not sure what's so special about it. Their portions are very small too. I wanted to try their baked salty egg oysters, but they were sold from the day before. That was a bummer. Their beef rice roll (cheong fun) has a hint of lemongrass that I'm not used to, but it wasn't bad. Their fried spicy crab roll was okay. Their chicken feet was bad. Their roast pork appetizer was ridiculously small. Most dim sum items were around $7-8 SGD. Literally, dim sum here cost double what it is in Chicago, and not even as good. The only thing I actually liked was their mini BBQ pork buns. We ordered a preserved meat fried rice, and the rice was so hard it was hard to swallow. Their service on the other hand was very good. They came and refilled tea very quickly, and changed our plates twice. The servers kept checking on us to see if we needed anything. Overall, I don't think it was worth it.

address: 76 Bras Basah Rd Level 2 Singapore 189558 Singapore
comment: Overall pretty good dim sum (3.5-4 stars), similar to Imperial Treasure although I think I still prefer the latter.
