Ordered the following dishes: Butter chicken, mutton pepper fry, prawn mango magic (of course we had to have the magic dish!), curry magic fish pollichath (recommended by the restaurant owner), various naan breads and some basmati rice. We also had the mango lassi and masala tea for drinks. Overall the portions served were slightly disappointing especially given the price of each dish. The mutton pepper fry and pollichath fish were probably the better dishes, the butter chicken was average and the prawn mango magic was not the best due to the overpowering coconut milk in the curry and very small prawns. As for the drinks the mango lassi was refreshingly good (slightly thick though) and the masala tea was served in very large cups (worth the money!). To summarise, the food is average and prices are slightly steep given the portions, nothing magical here, there are better places for Indian food within the area and for a much more affordable price.PS:  Pictures aren't the best.

One of the best local vegan restaurants. Service is friendly, always check on us to ensure satisfaction. Hainanese Chicken rice and Pancakes  run out fast. Some of my favorite: 奶油菇 (fried mushrooms), Assam Fish, shark Fin Soup, Dan Dan noodle, Duck Rice/Noodle, Fried Rice, Malay Noodle, and super awesome Mala Noodle (can range from mild to super duper spicy 变态辣)

Understand that they are very busy on a weekend but they are too irresponsible and arrogant staff that is in charge of taking care of take away orders. after waiting for 15mins I asked the staff to comform if the dishes are done as I see other coming before me has leave with their food. She unhappily shoo me away to say that my order has not been complete without checking on what have I ordered. After 30mins I had to flared to them that I have wait for so Long then a helpful staff went to check and notice that the kitchen missed out one of the dishes. No apology from her and what's next is she did not check that all the items are completed. I only realised that they missed out on my yong to fu soup When I am back home. Really not recommendable as the food standard falls badly as compared to before. Plus the long wait together with the bad customer service and irresponsible staff.

Very affordable vegetarian food. They have many outlets under different name such as D life and Zi Ran. Be sure to let Cook know if you don't want eggs or garlic in the dishes and they can customise for you. Don't forget to get the soya milk without sugar!

This vegetarian food place is located under a block of flat along Hougang Ave 4. There's more crowd on the 1st and 15th of lunar month and will have to wait a little longer than usual.The environment was clean enough but there is no air-con.They have over 100 vegetarian dishes.There are ramen and total of 17 kinds which are made by the china chef.They also have daily specials like lor me, ipoh prawn mee etc.I'm a soup lover and my favourite is their Herbal soup which is prepared by the boss daily.Recommended dishes are their Vegetarian Sharks Fins Ramen, Crispy Crème Abalone Mushroom, Hot Plate bean curd, Roti John, duck herbal soup etc.I will recommend this to vegetarians as there's so much choice. Price is affordable too.

First thing to note, the service is excellent and the staff, though not all local, speak at least decent English. Decent enough to take your orders, hold a conversation, and remember your order the next time you come back. An ace place for vegans to check out if you're looking for Dim Sum, the Xiao Long Bao and Steamed Dumplings are a great appetiser to what comes next. Divine Realm has everything from Roti Prata to Claypot Chicken to Ramen; it's extensive menu caters to individuals, groups, breakfast, lunch, dinner or supper. One must-try is the vegetarian pancake, which for good reason sells out really fast. Call in advance if you'd like to reserve one, and take home as many as you can. They're light, healthy and one of the best things Singapore's vegetarian scene has. Best thing is, everything is affordable and quite often really cheap. Expect to pay less than $20 for a main (rice, noodles, etc.) and 2 or 3 sides. My favourite vegetarian joint in the whole island! :)
